alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Franklin; St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 27 at 1:28PM EST until February 27 at 2:30PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Clinton County in northern New York... Franklin County in northern New York... St. Lawrence County in northern New York... * Until 230 PM EST. * At 123 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles north of Constable to Hannawa Falls to Cedar Island State Park, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts in excess of 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. Multiple videos have confirmed whiteout conditions within this snow squall. Observed wind gusts of up to 40 MPH have been reported by ASOS and mesonet. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes NY 11 east of Potsdam. Locations impacted include... Potsdam, Gouverneur, Canton, Mooers, Moira, Altona, De Kalb, Bangor, Fowler, Parishville, Fort Covington, Colton, Bombay, Ellenburg Depot, Champlain, Bryants Mill, Burke, Hammond, Brushton and Lawrenceville. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
